title: Relates to the powers and duties of the division of veterans' affairs; repealer
summary: Relates to the powers and duties of the division of veterans' affairs to establish, operate and maintain state veterans' cemeteries.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1386

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. ORTIZ, CANESTRARI, NOLAN, PHEFFER, SCHROEDER,
         HAWLEY, LUPARDO, LATIMER, M. MILLER -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of  A.
         CUSICK,  DESTITO, McDONOUGH, McENENY, REILLY -- read once and referred
         to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

       AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to powers and  duties  of
         the  division  of  veterans'  affairs; and to repeal subdivision 12 of
         section 353 of such law relating thereto

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  12  of  section  353 of the executive law is
    2  REPEALED and a new subdivision 12 is added to read as follows:
    3    12. TO ESTABLISH, OPERATE AND MAINTAIN STATE VETERANS' CEMETERIES  AND
    4  TO  MAKE APPLICATION TO THE GOVERNMENT OF THE UNITED STATES OR ANY POLI-
    5  TICAL SUBDIVISION, AGENCY OR INSTRUMENTALITY THEREOF, FOR FUNDS FOR  THE
    6  PURPOSE  OF  ESTABLISHING,  EXPANDING  OR  IMPROVING SUCH CEMETERIES. IN
    7  ADDITION, THE STATE MAY  VOLUNTARILY  ENTER  INTO  AGREEMENTS  WITH  ANY
    8  SUBDIVISION  OF  THE  STATE  FOR ASSISTANCE IN OPERATING AND MAINTAINING
    9  SUCH CEMETERIES. RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE PROPER AND RESPECTFUL  OPERATION
   10  OF SUCH CEMETERIES, HOWEVER, SHALL BE VESTED IN THE STATE AND SUFFICIENT
   11  FUNDING SHALL BE APPROPRIATED TO MAINTAIN AND OPERATE SUCH CEMETERIES AS
   12  FITTING  SHRINES  TO  THE MILITARY SERVICE OF THE VETERANS OF THE STATE.
   13  THE STATE SHALL OWN THE LAND ON  WHICH  SUCH  VETERANS'  CEMETERIES  ARE
   14  LOCATED.  LOCATIONS  SHOULD  BE  EASILY ACCESSIBLE BY ROADWAY TO CONCEN-
   15  TRATIONS OF VETERAN POPULATIONS. THE DIVISION SHALL HAVE  THE  AUTHORITY
   16  TO  ACCEPT  SUITABLE CEMETERY LAND, IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERAL VETERANS'
   17  CEMETERY GRANT GUIDELINES, FROM THE FEDERAL  GOVERNMENT,  STATE  GOVERN-
   18  MENT,  STATE  SUBDIVISIONS, PRIVATE SOURCES AND ANY OTHER SOURCE WISHING
   19  TO TRANSFER SUCH LAND FOR USE AS A VETERANS' CEMETERY.
   20    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   21  it shall have become a law.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03630-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to powers and duties of the division of veterans' affairs; and to repeal subdivision 12 of section 353 of such law relating thereto
